hypothesis_content.title: BTC-ETH Cointegration Breakout Pairs Trade
hypothesis_content.statement: When the 20-day rolling z-score of the BTC/ETH log price ratio exceeds ±2.0 standard deviations from its 200-day mean, the pair will mean-revert with 70% probability within 5 trading days when the overall market regime is NEUTRAL.
hypothesis_content.rationale: BTC and ETH maintain long-term equilibrium as the two largest crypto assets. During neutral regimes, speculative flows are reduced, allowing fundamental cointegration relationships to dominate. Volume ratio filter ensures both assets have comparable liquidity.
entry_conditions: BTC/ETH log price ratio 20-day z-score > +2.0 (short BTC, long ETH)
BTC/ETH log price ratio 20-day z-score < -2.0 (long BTC, short ETH)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Position closes when z-score crosses 0 (full mean reversion)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Position closes if z-score moves further to ±3.0
exit_conditions.time_exit: Close after 5 trading days regardless of P&L

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If less than 60% of trades are profitable OR average holding period return is negative after 100+ signals in neutral regimes.
